description:
Globisporangium iwayamae DAOM BR242034 is a species of water mold belonging to the oomycete genus Globisporangium. Oomycetes are a group of organisms that were historically classified as fungi but are now recognized as a distinct lineage of eukaryotic organisms.

Globisporangium iwayamae DAOM BR242034 is a heterotrophic, filamentous organism that reproduces through the formation of specialized reproductive structures called sporangia. The sporangia in this species are globose (spherical) in shape, which is a characteristic feature of the genus Globisporangium.

This species was originally isolated from soil samples collected in Japan and has been deposited in the Canadian Collection of Fungal Cultures (DAOM) with the accession number BR242034. It is an important model organism for the study of oomycete biology and evolution, as well as their ecological roles in various environments.
